This is just basically one of the most fun I've had with a problemsolver in ... ever. True, it's not the longest game, but it kept me on my toes every single step of the way with it's ingenousness! And the dark humor of the computer - in a league of it's own. Until Portal 2 came out, this was quite simply the best there was. And now, we'll, there's just more of it. Personally, I find this the game that you just need to have!

Wow! Such an amazing game that still holds up today despite it being released more than a decade ago. The game is short but every moment feels perfectly orchestrated. Would 100% recommend to friends and those new to PC. Thank me later xD

You don't play this game, you EXPERIENCE it! Portal is one of the best games I've played in a long time, with great mechanics, challenging, yet intuitive level design, and a great final boss battle. I highly recommend this game!!

I got Portal because I wanted a nice mix up on games I could play and... oh BOY did it deliver! Beating the game after so many stressful moments made this game amazing. Previously I had only seen videos of game play, but not actually played the game myself until I realized it was a mistake on not getting it sooner (thank you Autumn Sale for making this game and its sequel $1.48). If you like a nice, semi-challenging, physics-based puzzle game, then this is the game for you! Even if you've never heard of Portal, go check out some videos on YouTube or other media services and see if it is the right game for you!

[b]So basically, I gotten the game just to get the recipe of the cake.[/b]

In this game, you are [strike]trapped[/strike] working in a facility trying to [strike]escape[/strike] help learn more about science with a grand price of [strike]death[/strike] Cake at the end. You help the facility to understand more about portals with interesting [strike]Death Traps[/strike] Puzzle Rooms/Test Chambers. Will you conquer it all?

This game is amazing which understandable why this game is part of [i]The Orange Box[/i] with other great games called Half Life 2, HL2 Episode 1 and Episode 2 and Team Fortress 2. The puzzles in this game are fun and (spoiller) [spoiler] it shows a lot when you try to escape the facility [/spoiler]. As with the other games in [i]The Orange Box[/i], it show the capabilities of the new [i]Source Engine[/i] with it showing how it can simulate physics and infinite gateways. Even if you finsh the campaign, there are some bonus challenges you could try to test your skill and your limits. While playing, you will find some interesting lore that continues in the sequel. I highly recommend this game for people who like puzzles in a 3D First Person Game.

I remember playing this game on my old laptop. It always felt super creepy that you are the only one in Aperture Laboratories. But i always get this vibe with other Source games for some reason. But this game will always live on in my heart.

Ein Klassiker, den man einfach gespielt haben muss!
Dieses Spiel mag inzwischen in die Jahre gekommen sein, erfÃ¼llt jedoch in allen Punkten meine WÃ¼nsche. Das Spiel ist nicht all zu schwer zu verstehen, ist Humorvoll und bietet ein einzigartiges Think'n'Run-Spielsystem. Grafik und Sounds sind aus der gleichen Engine wie von Halflife 2, da dieses Spiel Teil der Halflife-Geschichte ist.
